blocks.name: classifyImage
blocks.description: Upload URLs to identify classes by default.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: imageUrl
args.info: The URL of an image (.jpg, or .png).

args.name: owners
args.info: A comma-separated list with the value(s) 'IBM' and/or 'me' to specify which classifiers to run.

args.name: classifierIds
args.info: A comma-separated list of the classifier IDs used to classify the images. 'Default' is the classifier_id of the built-in classifier.

args.name: threshold
args.info: A floating value that specifies the minimum score a class must have to be displayed in the response. Setting the threshold to 0.0 will return all values, regardless of their classification score.

args.name: threshold
args.info: A floating value that specifies the minimum score a class must have to be displayed in the response. Setting the threshold to 0.0 will return all values, regardless of their classification score.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Specifies the language of the output. You can specify en for English, es for Spanish, ar for Arabic, or ja for Japanese. Classifiers for which no translation is available are ommitted.

blocks.name: detectFaces
blocks.description: Analyze faces in images and get data about them, such as estimated age, gender, plus names of celebrities.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: imageUrl
args.info: The URL of an image (.jpg, or .png).

blocks.name: createClassifier
blocks.description: Train a new multi-faceted classifier on the uploaded image data.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: className
args.info: The name of the new classifier.

args.name: positiveExampleImages1
args.info: A compressed (.zip) file of images that depict the visual subject for a class within the new classifier. Must contain a minimum of 10 images. Minimum recommend size is 32X32 pixels.

args.name: positiveExampleImagesName1
args.info: The name of the positive examples in 1 file

args.name: positiveExampleImages2
args.info: A compressed (.zip) file of images that depict the visual subject for a class within the new classifier. Must contain a minimum of 10 images. Minimum recommend size is 32X32 pixels.

args.name: positiveExampleImagesName2
args.info: The name of the positive examples in 2 file

args.name: negativeExampleImages
args.info: A compressed (.zip) file of images that do not depict the visual subject of any of the classes of the new classifier. Must contain a minimum of 10 images.

blocks.name: getCustomClassifiers
blocks.description: Retrieve a list of user-created classifiers.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: verbose
args.info: Specify true to return classifier details. Omit this parameter to return a brief list of classifiers.

blocks.name: getSingleClassifier
blocks.description: Retrieve information about a specific classifier.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: classifierId
args.info: The ID of the classifier for which you want details.

blocks.name: updateClassifier
blocks.description: Update an existing classifier by adding new classes, or by adding new images to existing classes.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: classifierId
args.info: The id of the classifier.

args.name: positiveExampleImages
args.info: A compressed (.zip) file of images that depict the visual subject for a class within the new classifier. Must contain a minimum of 10 images. Minimum recommend size is 32X32 pixels.

args.name: positiveExampleImagesName
args.info: The name of the positive examples in 1 file

args.name: negativeExampleImages
args.info: A compressed (.zip) file of images that do not depict the visual subject of any of the classes of the new classifier. Must contain a minimum of 10 images.

blocks.name: deleteClassifier
blocks.description: Delete a specific classifier.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: classifierId
args.info: The ID of the classifier for which you want to delete.

blocks.name: createCollection
blocks.description: Beta. Create a new collection of images to search. You can create a maximum of 5 collections.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionName
args.info: The name of the new collection. The name can be a maximum of 128 UTF8 characters, with no spaces.

blocks.name: getCollections
blocks.description: Beta. List all custom collections.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

blocks.name: getSingleCollection
blocks.description: Beta. Retrieve information about a specific collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

blocks.name: addImageToCollection
blocks.description: Beta. Add images to a collection. Each collection can contain 1000000 images. It takes 1 second to upload 1 images, so uploading 1000000 images takes 11 days.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

args.name: imageFile
args.info: Image file

args.name: imageMetadata
args.info: A json object file that adds metadata to the image. This can be anything that can be specified in a JSON object. For example, key-value pairs.

blocks.name: getCollectionImages
blocks.description: Beta. List 100 images in a collection. This returns an arbitrary selection of 100 images. Each collection can contain 1000000 images.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

blocks.name: getCollectionSingleImage
blocks.description: Beta. List details about a specific image in a collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

args.name: imageId
args.info: The id of the image.

blocks.name: addMetadataToImage
blocks.description: Beta. Add metadata to a specific image in a collection. Use metadata for your own reference to identify images.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

args.name: imageId
args.info: The id of the image.

args.name: imageMetadataFile
args.info: A json object file that adds metadata to the image. This can be anything that can be specified in a JSON object. For example, key-value pairs.

blocks.name: updateImageMetadata
blocks.description: Beta. Update  metadata to a specific image in a collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

args.name: imageId
args.info: The id of the image.

args.name: imageMetadataFile
args.info: A json object file that adds metadata to the image. This can be anything that can be specified in a JSON object. For example, key-value pairs.

blocks.name: getSingleImageMetadata
blocks.description: Beta. View the metadata for a specific image in a collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

args.name: imageId
args.info: The id of the image.

blocks.name: deleteSingleImageMetadata
blocks.description: Beta. Delete the metadata for a specific image in a collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

args.name: imageId
args.info: The id of the image.

blocks.name: findSimilarImagesInCollection
blocks.description: Beta. Upload an image to find similar images in your custom collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

args.name: imageFile
args.info: The image file (.jpg or .png) of the image to search against the collection. Minimum recommend size is 32X32 pixels.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of similar results you want returned. Default limit is 10 results, you can specify a maximum limit of 100 results.

blocks.name: deleteImageFromCollection
blocks.description: Beta. Delete an image from a collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.

args.name: imageId
args.info: The id of the image.

blocks.name: deleteCollection
blocks.description: Beta. Delete a specific collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from IBM

args.name: version
args.info: The release date of the version of the API you want to use.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The id of the collection.
